messages.title: A fresh start for the NHS
messages.content: David met with NHS users and professionals in Gainsborough to discuss Labour's plans for our health service.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Plans for the NHS include recruiting 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs, guaranteeing GP appointments within 48 hours and cancer tests in one week.
Plans for reducing class sizes to less than 30 for 5, 6 and 7-year-olds and opening up vocational and apprenticeship opportunities.
Proposes to stop the RBS sell-off saving billions, and promises to promote and grow start-up firms and champion British manufacturing to create more job opportunities.

issues.economy: David will fight to improve our high streets with more visitors, more jobs and a better deal for private companies and jobs.
issues.education: David has been speaking to parents and teachers about how we can help young people achieve their full potential.
issues.health: David met with NHS users and professionals in Gainsborough to discuss Labour's plans for our health service.

leaflet.personalStatement: David has been speaking to parents and teachers about how we can help young people achieve their full potential.

politicalExperience.role: BBC producer, start-up advisor, and entrepreneur
politicalExperience.achievements: Launched Look North economic initiative, stopped RBS handing out £1 billion of shares without consultation.

endorsements.endorsement: Valuable insight into the strategic issues restricting economic growth and has real plans to help small businesses prosper.
Understands the importance of ensuring young people have good opportunities.
An MP who's going to make a difference to the economic life of Gainsborough and improve the NHS.
Dedicated and efficient campaigner who keeps his promises.
